00015 static bool *enable_run;
00016 static int grace_time;
00017 
00018 
00019 size_t CopyFile(FILE *source,FILE *dest)
00020 {
00021   char buf[256];
00022   size_t len, total=0;
00023 
00024   while((len = fread(buf,sizeof(char),256,source)) > 0){
00025     fwrite(buf,sizeof(char),len,dest);
00026     total += len;
00027   }
00028 
00029   return(total);
00030 }
00031 
00032 void HandleStop(int i)
00033 // Signal handler for breaks (Ctrl-C)
00034 {
00035   // clear running flag, and set up alarm in case we've hung
00036   alarm(grace_time);
00037   if(enable_run) *enable_run = false;
00038 }
00039 
00040 void HandleAlarm(int i)
00041 // Signal handler that forces an exit when the code hangs on Ctrl-C
00042 {
00043   exit(0);
00044 }
00045 
00046 void InitHandleStop(bool *_enable_run,int _grace_time)
00047 {
00048   enable_run = _enable_run;
00049   grace_time = (_grace_time > 0)? _grace_time : 1;
00050 
00051   // Connect the stop signals
00052   signal(SIGINT,HandleStop);
00053   signal(SIGALRM,HandleAlarm);
00054 }
00055 
00056 bool Renice(int nice,bool verbose)
00057 {
00058   int old_prio = getpriority(PRIO_PROCESS,0);
00059   setpriority(PRIO_PROCESS,0,nice);
00060   int new_prio = getpriority(PRIO_PROCESS,0);
00061 
00062   if(verbose && new_prio!=old_prio){
00063     printf("renice: %d -> %d\n",old_prio,new_prio);
00064   }
00065   return(new_prio == nice);
00066 }

00068 void GetDateStr(CharString &date)
00069 {
00070   struct tm cur;
00071   GetDate(cur);
00072   date.printf("%04d%02d%02d-%02d%02d",
00073               1900+cur.tm_year, cur.tm_mon+1, cur.tm_mday,
00074               cur.tm_hour, cur.tm_min);
00075 }
00076 
00077 bool SetTimerInterrupt(unsigned int interval, void (*callback)(int))
00078 {
00079   struct itimerval value, ovalue, pvalue;
00080   struct sigaction sact;
00081   
00082   value.it_interval.tv_sec = 0;
00083   value.it_interval.tv_usec = interval;
00084   value.it_value.tv_sec = 0;
00085   value.it_value.tv_usec = interval;
00086   
00087   sigemptyset( &sact.sa_mask );
00088   sact.sa_flags = 0;
00089   sact.sa_handler = callback;
00090   sigaction( SIGALRM, &sact, NULL );
00091   
00092   getitimer( ITIMER_REAL, &pvalue );
00093   setitimer( ITIMER_REAL, &value, &ovalue );
00094   
00095   if( ovalue.it_interval.tv_sec != pvalue.it_interval.tv_sec  ||
00096     ovalue.it_interval.tv_usec != pvalue.it_interval.tv_usec ||
00097     ovalue.it_value.tv_sec != pvalue.it_value.tv_sec ||
00098     ovalue.it_value.tv_usec != pvalue.it_value.tv_usec ){
00099     return false;
00100   }
00101   return true;
00102 }
00103 
00104 void CancelTimerInterrupts()
00105 {
00106   struct itimerval value;
00107   int whichTimer = ITIMER_REAL;
00108   getitimer( whichTimer, &value );
00109   value.it_value.tv_sec = 0;
00110   value.it_value.tv_usec = 0;
00111   setitimer( whichTimer, &value, NULL );
00112 }
